org.anchoranalysis.io.input.bean.descriptivename

Class FileNamer

  • Object
    • AnchorBean<FileNamer>
      • FileNamer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileNamerIndependent, PatternSpan, RemoveExtensions

    public abstract class FileNamer
extends AnchorBean<FileNamer>
    Associates a name (a compact unique identifier) with a file.

    The operation can be procesed on a single file or a collection of files.

    Author:
    Owen Feehan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileNamer()

      abstract List<NamedFile> deriveName(Collection<File> files, String elseName, Logger logger)
      Derives a list of names (associated with each file) for some files.
      NamedFile deriveName(File file, String elseName, Logger logger)
      A name for a file
      List<NamedFile> deriveNameUnique(Collection<File> files, Logger logger)
      Like deriveNameUnique(Collection, String, Logger) but with a default for elseName.
      List<NamedFile> deriveNameUnique(Collection<File> files, String elseName, Logger logger)
      Like deriveName(Collection, String, Logger) but checks that the final list of named-files all have unique names

    • Method Detail

      • deriveName

        public NamedFile deriveName(File file,
                            String elseName,
                            Logger logger)
        A name for a file
        Parameters:
        file - the file to extract a name for
        elseName - a fallback name to use if something goes wrong
        Returns:
        the file combined with an extracted name

      • deriveNameUnique

        public List<NamedFile> deriveNameUnique(Collection<File> files,
                                        Logger logger)
                                 throws InputReadFailedException
        Like deriveNameUnique(Collection, String, Logger) but with a default for elseName.
        Parameters:
        files - the files to describe
        logger - the logger
        Returns:
        a list of identical size and order to files, corresponding to the file the extracted name
        Throws:
        InputReadFailedException - if more than one NamedFile have the same name

      • deriveName

        public abstract List<NamedFile> deriveName(Collection<File> files,
                                           String elseName,
                                           Logger logger)
        Derives a list of names (associated with each file) for some files.
        Parameters:
        files - the files to describe
        elseName - a string to use if an error occurs extracting a particular name (used as a prefix with an index)
        logger - the logger
        Returns:
        a list of identical size and order to files, corresponding to the file the extracted name

      • deriveNameUnique

        public List<NamedFile> deriveNameUnique(Collection<File> files,
                                        String elseName,
                                        Logger logger)
                                 throws InputReadFailedException
        Like deriveName(Collection, String, Logger) but checks that the final list of named-files all have unique names
        Parameters:
        files - the files to describe
        elseName - a string to use if an error occurs extracting a particular name (used as a prefix with an index)
        logger - the logger
        Returns:
        a list of identical size and order to files, corresponding to the file the extracted name
        Throws:
        InputReadFailedException - if more than one NamedFile have the same name
